<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Ancestral Geometry](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2202)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Tattoo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=262" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 119 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 30 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** tattooed on the body

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Geometric precision and perfect angles signify that an artist with exemplary knowledge of [dwarven](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=1) tattooing traditions created this body art. Your family's ancestral stories, recited throughout the tattooing process, bind your blood even tighter to theirs. During your daily preparations, you manifest a visitation by an ancestor—possibly via a dream, a vision, or a magical trinket left by your bedroll. Roll 2d20 and record the highest result. Then roll 1d6 and note a type of saving throw: 1–2 Fortitude, 3–4 Reflex, and 5–6 Will.

 In addition, until the next visitation, you gain a +1 item bonus to one [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skill related to the ancestor, as determined by the GM. Usually, the ancestor provides a kind of knowledge they believe you'll need. For dwarven ancestors, the Lore skill is usually Architecture Lore, Engineering Lore, Genealogy Lore, Labor Lore, Mining Lore, Warfare Lore, or Lore about a dwarven deity.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=612)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You rolled a saving throw of the noted type;  **Effect** Replace the roll with the d20 roll from your ancestor's visitation.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Ancestral Geometry
